intro: Diodia apiculata, commonly known as the sharpleaf diodia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant features small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters, typically from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and pointed, with a distinctive sharp tip, contributing to its common name. Diodia apiculata is often found in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and grasslands.
